intro: Anagallis kigesiensis, commonly known as the Kigesi mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
